sources.snippet: ","Key components of a VM include virtual CPU (vCPU), virtual RAM, virtual hard disk, virtual network interface card (vNIC), and optionally virtual GPU and USB controllers.

sources.snippet: ","The hypervisor manages resource allocation and isolation between VMs and the host hardware, ensuring independent operation.

sources.snippet: ","VMs are widely used in cloud computing, software development, testing, server consolidation, and running legacy applications.

sources.snippet: ","Types of virtual machines include system VMs (full OS virtualization) and process VMs (run single applications), as well as specialized forms like desktop virtualization, server virtualization, OS virtualization, and network functions virtualization.
